## Course Objectives
This four credit core course is designed:

::: incremental

-   To make the students proficient in the coding of linear algebra operations using Python.  
-   To train the students in defining, applying and manipulating vectors and matrices computationally and performing matrix operations with confidence.  
-   Understand the concept of contour integrals and apply those formulas to solve contour integrals 
-   To train the students in the implementation of PCA for data compression and feature selection. 
-   To  develop studentâ€™s capabilities in applying matrix operations for image filtering and compression. 

:::
::: footer
Learn more: [Syllabus-20MA201](https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/revealjs/#incremental-lists)
:::

## Course Outcomes {.smaller}
Upon successful completion of this course, the student will be able to:

::: incremental

-   Set up a computational environment to represent and process the linear algebraic constructs in applied mathematics.  
-   Use advanced Python libraries to represent, model and solve real-time problems with Linear Algebra.   
-   Use linear algebra to transform data and apply dimensionality reduction. 
-   Use linear algebra to perform basic image processing tasks. 
-   Use matrix operations to interpret both theoretical and computational aspects of Machine Learning and Data Science.   

:::
